D3 - Scale

Created:2018-09-15  Last modified:2018-11-11

  • Scale
  • Axis
  • References

  1. Scale (From Data Domain To Space Range)

    We specify a fixed SVG drawing space in our webpage and scale the data to fit in the dedicated area.

    Moreover, we need convert non-quantitative attribute into quantitative in order to display them.

    D3 Scale function

    D3 provides some scale functions, such as linear, square root, logarithmic, and ordinal

    1. Number Scale 
                      // var scale = d3.scaleLinear(), d3.scaleLog().base(2), d3.scalePow();
                var scale = d3.scaleLinear().domain([0,20000]).range([0,400]);
                // the svg's axis is 400 pixel, but real data range from 0 to 20000
                
                // usage of the scale is a function.
                var x = scale(2000); // return 2000 * 400 / 20000 = 40
    2. Time Scale 
                          d3.scaleTime().domain([Date, Date]).range([num1, num2])
    3. Color Scale 
                      var colorScale = d3.scaleOrdinal(d3.schemeCategory10);
                colorScale(100);
                // <script src="//d3js.org/d3-scale-chromatic.v0.3.min.js"></script>
                var blueColorScale = d3.scaleSequential(d3.interpolateBlues); // it has output range
                blueColorScale.domain([0, 1000]); // define input domain
                blueColorScale(100); // return a color
                <script src="//d3js.org/d3-scale-chromatic.v0.3.min.js"><script>
    4. Range and domain are not always static, they can be reused and change at runtime 
                      scale = d3.scaleLinear().domain([0,20000]);
                var new_scale = scale.range([0,300]);
                var new_scale_2 = scale.range([0,20]);
    5. Auxiliary functions 
                      d3.max(arr) // return the max in the arr, arr need to a numerical value.
                d3.max(arr, ()=>{});
                // d3.max(array.map(()=>{})); return the max numerical value.
                d3.min // same.
                d3.extent(arr, ()=>{}); // return [min, max]
    6. Scale on Y asix: scale is drawn on Y asix from top to bottom, so if the origin is on the left bottom corner, then: 
                      // .range([max-height, 0]);

  2. Axis

    1. Direction: 
                              // axisBottom: tick facing down
                        var xAxis = d3.axisBottom(scale).ticks(6);
                        // scale is the scale function, which has the range.
                        svg.append('g')
                            // .attr('class', 'x axis') // perphas you want style it.
                            .attr('transform', 'translate(80,250)') // go to position
                            .call(xAxis);
                        svg.append('text') // add label
                            .attr('class', 'x label')
                            .attr('transform', 'translate(230,290)')
                            .text('Coffee Shop Sales ($)');
    2. Customized Ticks: 
                              // widthScale log 2 scale
                        var horizontalAxis =d3.axisBottom(widthScale)
                            .tickSizeInner(-1 * max-height) // show a grid
                            .tickValues([500, 1000, 2000, 4000, 8000, 16000, 32000, 64000]);
